metadata.title: CVE-2022-34484 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
The Mozilla Fuzzing Team reported potential vulnerabilities present inThunderbird 91.10. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruptionand we presume that with enough effort some of these could have beenexploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 102,Firefox ESR < 91.11, Thunderbird < 102, and Thunderbird < 91.11.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34484` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.11.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.11.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.11.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.11.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.11.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.11.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.11.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
